page.title: 16Local events in Leverton
page.content: 1985 was the 25th anniversary of the Leverton Show and Gymkhana.This event is held annually towards the end of July and has grown over the years into its present form.The Show is held to raise money for the Village Hall(not contained within the block)to defray running expenses.There are competitions for village people in many different classes ranging from cookery to vegetable classes,home-made wine and handicrafts.Local traders and craftsmen are also represented and this year there were demonstrations by a military preservation group and a Taekwando group.The gymkhana has the usual horse events but is restricted to local competitors.A superstars event is also hotly contested between local teams of athletes.Many cups and trophies are awarded to winners generously donated by local firms.
